newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ASMI to seek Amsterdam listing.
newsitem.headline: ASMI to seek Amsterdam listing.

text.p: Advanced Semiconductors Materials Internationals NV (ASMI) said on Tuesday it had applied to list its shares on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange.
"The company's intention is to effect the listing during the current quarter," ASMI said in a statement.
The company's shares are already quoted on the electronic NASDAQ exchange in the U.S.

ASMI said it wanted its stock to become more accessible to a broader base of investors and added that an Amsterdam listing would serve certain European institutional investors which could only invest in European-listed securities.
ASMI makes equipment to produce semiconductors. In July, the company posted 1996 first half net profit of 54.3 million guilders, up from 22.2 million in the year-ago period.
First-half turnover grew to 368.6 million guilders from 300.7 million in the first six months of 1995.
